item.title: I go skiing in the summer! Exploring Yongpyong Resort - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Summer ski resorts are all `` green ''

I go skiing in the summer! Exploring Yongpyong Resort

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

Is it a tree frog? Be sure to visit late spring or summer, not winter. The ski slopes at this time of year when the white slopes have turned into a lush green garden and the crowds have disappeared are peaceful. What do you have to do at the ski resort on summer days? You do not know. Unique summer sports fills the ski and snowboard retreat. In the early weekend when the hot weather was on the rise, Yongpyong Resort in Pyeongchang, Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do, enjoyed the exhilarating sports.
Do I try MTB too?
Confession, there was a time when I was looking for a ski resort to learn skiing. But one day I realized Not everyone can love skiing and snowboarding. Especially if you're as cold as you are. Unfortunately, it wasn't until summer that I was able to walk back to the ski slopes. One hot summer, at Daegwallyeong Yongpyong Resort, I faced the cool and lush landscape and wind.
As the heat started early this year, he led his family to Daegwallyeong. Daegwallyeong is much cooler than other areas, and there are plenty of things to do, including exotic ranches and large resorts. So it's perfect for a cool and exciting summer day.
We go to Yongpyong Resort for a walk and enjoy sports. Summer ski resorts have a different color and atmosphere than winter. The white-white landscape hides its traces and the surroundings are 'green'.
People enjoying MTB at Yongpyong Resort
The first thing you noticed at Yongpyong Resort is the MTB riders who race through the green. A group of riders ride their bikes downhill and jump from a slightly protruding chin. At the moment, the bicycle disintegrates and descends. It's short, but it makes a strong impression as if you were dealing with a slow motion effect. Watching riders jump from young children to adults.
The scene of jumping is thrilling just by looking at it.
Suddenly, it reminded me of the scenery I saw in Whistler, Canada many years ago. It was a fresh shock when many riders raced down the MTB at Whistler Ski Resort, which was standing on the summer road. Riding the bicycle while the wind was cool and exciting. Let's learn MTB to Koreans outside Korea. To challenge spirit. Of course, it's been a while since then.
MTB Riders Spot the Grass
A few years later, he faced an MTB riding scene at Yongpyong Resort. In the meantime, there has been a bicycle boom in Korea and many MTB users. At the same time, two MTB parks, which consisted of naturally mountain bike trails, began to emerge. Yongpyong Resort MTB Park opened in 2015. People come from various groups, including clubs, family and friends. Adult men and women as well as teenagers use the MTB park.
MTB Riders Spot the Grass
I went to the MTB center and riders gathered on the deck for a while. There are men in their 40s and 50s who came from the club, and middle school students who came to the MTB park for the first time and high school students who came with friends. Foreigners who have taken a plane to experience Yongpyong Resort MTB Park are also eye-catching. They come from Ireland and Thailand and have been riding the MTB here for three days and the course is quite attractive.
Various people enjoy the MTB Park.
'I want to ride once MTB' comes up again. Is it possible to use Yongpyong Resort MTB Park even for beginners without equipment preparation? Of course. There is a separate course for beginners at MTB Park, and rental bicycles and protective gear. MTB Park staff will also accompany the participants several times to guide the course. If you feel that you are familiar with the course, you can enjoy riding alone.
People preparing to depart MTB
You don't have to be scared how to climb a bike. This is because it is a course where you go up the lift and enjoy the downhill. There are originally five courses, depending on how each course is combined. You can enjoy 15 different courses.
Lift boarding ground
Admission tickets are 25,000 won for half day including lift fee and 35,000 won for weekly.
I am riding MTB under the lift.
Exhilarating sports to forget the heat
What if they are so envious of riding the MTB and aren't ready to ride right now? Enjoy the mountain coaster. You can ride a mountain coaster instead of a bicycle to race through the meadow. Take the same lift as the MTB riders to the boarding area.
Take the lift to the mountain coaster boarding area
Mountain coasters ride on sleds and slide down rails. Yongpyong Resort Mountain Coaster has a total length of 1300m and a maximum speed of 40km. The feeling of speed with bare body is quite fast. The operation method is easy. Speed up and slow down with one lever. Young children can also be used with their parents. Feeling like you're sliding down a green mountain foot is the `` let '' itself!
Ride through the forest on a mountain coaster
When you come down the mountain coaster, you will see buggy cars and four-wheeled motorcycles aside. Ride a buggy or four-wheeled motorcycle and off-road against the green slopes. It's not a good road, but a fun driving experience in Yongpyong Resort's nature. It feels cool to ride a bumpy road on a buggy.
Let's run off-road with buggy car
There are also leisure facilities next to the Buggy River Four Wheel Motorcycle Experience Center. There are various experiences to satisfy every age group from young children to adults. Children's electric cars, air bumper cars, triway, horse riding and so on. There's also a Segway, which Steve Jobs praised as "the best invention ever since PC" (unfortunately, it didn't resonate).
There is also an electric car for children.
Segway was developed in 2001 by an American inventor named Dean Carmen. One person stands and rides on the balance of the body. The sensor measures the occupant's center of gravity movement in hundredths of a second, balancing it against falling. It can be used from the 3rd grade of elementary school and from 20kg or more
There are various experiences such as horse riding through the meadow.
Listen to the guide and learn the basics. There is no device like a brake at all. Only body balance moves. Anyone can enjoy the basic motions such as forward, stop, and rotate. It consists of a course where you learn the basics and take a look around with your guide. The general experience lasts about 20 minutes and the mountain experience using the mountain segway takes about 30 minutes.
Segway that anyone can easily enjoy by learning the basics

Her 40-year-old husband and 10-year-old daughter raise their thumbs after riding the Segway. It's very fun. Well… . The downside of Segway is aftereffects. My husband wants to buy a Segway, and her daughter searches for the internet and asks her to go to Yongpyong Resort for a Segway ride. You may have to endure this aftereffect.


It's getting hotter. If you are looking for a cool and fun place, put Yongpyong Resort on the list. You will agree with the 'frog frog' traveler's claim that skiing is a fun place in summer.

Take a look around with the guide

item.title: All of the red snow crab, winter snow on the scab! - Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Steamed red snow crab

All of the red snow crab, winter snow on the scab!

Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea

Sokcho is known as the red crab producing area called red snow crab. Among them, Dongmyeong Port boasts abundant quantities thanks to the red crab boat going in and out. Most people choose “Grab crab” as their delicacy on the east coast, and “Hong crab”, which is being pushed by snow crabs and treated as a two-factor, is also a delicacy. Today I searched for red crabs that can be tasted cheaper than (normal) snow crabs throughout the coast of Gangwon-do.
Snow crab is one of the best on the winter coast. Usually crab legs are elongated and named like bamboo. If you solve it in Chinese characters, it becomes Jukhae (竹 蟹). Red snow crab leading to red crab is similar to snow crab, and sometimes it can be mistaken as snow crab.
Where is it? The neighborhood where you live is different. Most crabs live in depths of 30-1800m and red crabs in soft mud or sandy bottoms. At the depth of 450 ~ 600m, blue crab, a hybrid of snow crab and red crab, is located. It resembles a snow crab and is called ‘You too snow crab’.
It is not difficult to distinguish snow crab from red snow crab!
Before tasting red snow crab, let's take a look. The highest peak of snow crab is bakdae crab. Some people consider ‘박달대게’ as a proper noun. Whether it is domestic or imported, if the flesh is full, it is ‘박달대게’. Normally, domestic prices are set by maridang and imported by weight. You can also see snow crabs in Sokcho, known as the main area for red crabs. The price is flexible, but the average kg is about 100,000 won.
snow crab
It is usually crab although it is less full. The snow crab has a slightly dark brown color instead of the bright red color of the red crab. The color of the snow crab is more noticeable. After the crab is boiled, it turns into a pale pink color with a golden color. The red crab, which was red before steaming, is vivid after it is boiled. There are differences in appearance, but the difference is obvious in taste. If you taste crab and red crab together, you can feel the difference in taste.
Red snow crab
The crab's flesh is sweet. Sweet mussels melt gently in your mouth. When the soft and sweet crab comes into red rather than taste, it comes with a salty taste. Red crabs, which have a relatively salty taste, are often thought to be cheaper than snow crabs. Some of the crabs are filled with red crabs, boasting a ransom equivalent to snow crabs. Still, most of them cannot keep up with the price. Hong crabs, which are caught a lot at this time, boast a ransom ranging from 20,000 won to 6-70,000 won per kg. Red crab with various ransom, where should I eat something?
Snow crab and red snow crab
Some ways to taste red snow crab
“Finding Sokcho Dongmyeong Port with red crabs is the first way to eat fresh red crabs at the cheapest price. It's the cheapest way to buy red crabs at the Dongmyeong Port market and eat them on the 2nd floor of Dongmyeong Live Fish Center. You should eat red crabs at 30,000 won per kilogram. If you hold about 1kg per person, you eat For example, for a family of four, you can taste red crabs for about 120,000 won. ”
Directed red crab market in Dongmyeong Port, Sokcho, Gangwon-do
The red snow crab caught in a trap or net can be eaten all season except July-August. If you spray the traps in the deep sea of more than 1000m and save them, you will come with red crabs that came into the trap. The crabs caught in the trap are fresher than the nets laid in shallow water.
Sokcho-si Suyeong Livestock Center
Even when it's hot, it often dies on the way, and the cold wind is now red. The meat is full and the catch is plenty, which makes it relatively cheap.
Sogecho-si Suhyup Red Crab Plate located behind the Dongmyeong Live Fish Center
I have to pick a red crab at the market. How do I find a crab filled with flesh?
Dongmyeong Live Fish Center 2F
“When I look at the red crab, I see a white strip. Right now, most of the crab meat is full, and this white string is 80% full. Less white lines or faint whites are almost 100% full. It's a different color. Actually, the color is dark and vivid. Knowing this will help you pick a red crab. ”
If you see a white line on your belly, your flesh is not full.
This is the description of the owner of Sokcho Dongmyeong Port. Instead, it's cheaper than eating at a restaurant, but there's no service to cut crabs.
Nearly 100% full of red crab
If you buy crabs at the market, they give you a service. You can take the crab to the 2nd floor of Dongmyeong Live Fish Center or eat it.
Steamed red snow crab
The rice cooked in the crab is also special. When you put crab in a scab and mix it, it tastes like honey without soy sauce or other condiments. On the 2nd floor of Dongmyeong Live Fish Center, you can order rice cooked separately.
If you mix crab with rice, you can feel the rich taste.
You can add a spicy soup to 4,000 won (2 people or more) per person.
Dongmyeong Fresh Fish Center Maeuntang
Of course, there are many places where you can taste red snow crab besides Sokcho Dongmyeong Port. Sokcho Tourist Fish Market Underground, restaurants around Dongmyeong Port, and restaurants that boast red snow crabs around the public playground. It is no exaggeration to say that red snow crabs are caught throughout the east coast, but Sokcho is one of the areas that are not to be missed.
A red snow crab with a vivid red color like its name
Just steamed without any seasoning, delicious red crab. In Sokcho, where there are abundant red crabs, there are specialty red crab restaurants where you can taste various red crab dishes such as black crab radish and red crab ramen. When you eat a variety of cooked crabs, the crab-shelled chitin can help lower cholesterol while preventing fat from accumulating in your body. Not only does it taste good, but it also takes care of your health. You can eat red snow crab with a little bit of cheongju and steam for 15 minutes. Before spring, why don't you go on a trip to enjoy the red crab with fresh sea.
Toss with red crab seasoned with seasoned red snow crab

item.title: Enjoy ski slopes in advance at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics! 'Parallel Rotation' and 'Cross' Course at Phoenix Pyeongchang - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Skiers relaxing on snowy slopes

Enjoy ski slopes in advance at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics! 'Parallel Rotation' and 'Cross' Course at Phoenix Pyeongchang

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

The skiers and skaters, who cut through the snow at 140 km / h and tumble over high obstacles, sweat their hands just by looking at them. The opportunity to meet in advance the impression of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympic Games that have been coming up for a year, or to enjoy it. where? Phoenix Pyeongchang! how? If you are curious, let's leave.
Winter Olympic Games in Phoenix Pyeongchang
The Pyeongchang Winter Olympics Games, which will open on February 9, 2018, will take place in three cities, Pyeongchang, Gangneung and Jeongseon, Gangwon-do.
Skiing and boarding 9 events in Phoenix Pyeongchang
Three ski resorts, Phoenix Pyeongchang, Yongpyeong Resort, and Alpensia Resort, are located in Pyeongchang, where snow sports are held. This means that you can try out slopes for athletes before the Olympics. It's a thrilling news for those who ski and board a bit.
Skiing and boarding 9 events in Phoenix Pyeongchang
Phoenix Pyeongchang will host 5 freestyle skis and 4 snowboards during the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics snow games. Two athletes start at the same time to compete in parallel parallel rotation, a slope-style called the circus on snow, a moggle that uses techniques to turn and turn using jumps, the most exciting aerial among freestyle skiing, and air smoke on a semi-cylinder slope. Unfolding half-pipes and crosses that have to compete to speed through various obstacles. Six of the 21-side slopes of Phoenix Pyeongchang are used as Olympic venues.
There are eight lifts, six sunkids and eight-seater gondola.
Exciting Parallel Spinning Course
The parallel large round, a snowboard only race, is located at the left end of the Phoenix Pyeongchang ski base. The parallel rotation, with two players starting at the same time and winning quickly, is the most exciting of the snowboard games.
A parallel run is a game that passes a gate designated as a board game.
When you snowboard, you can think of brilliant skills such as spin and jump, but parallel rotation is a game that enjoys speed as much as technology.
Both board and ski can be used during the opening period
Parallel turns must pass through at least 18 gates on the slope to the finish line. Therefore, it is important to be as close to the gate as it is to speed, so it is how to come down while reducing the radius of rotation.
Both board and ski can be used during the opening period
The parallel anti-rotation slope has a length of 581 m and an average inclination of 16 degrees. Theoretically, anyone with an intermediate level of skill can use it, but to experience the beauty of the slopes, you need more. That way, you'll experience the thrill of rotation and the thrill of turning your body like a motorcycle rider every time you switch speeds and turns.
Parallel course course has a length of 581m and an average inclination of about 16 degrees.
It is a snowboarding arena, but skiers can also use it during the open hours. Compared to other slopes, there are few people who use it, and the slope management is the best for riding.
Parallel course course has a length of 581m and an average inclination of about 16 degrees.
Freestyle splendor added to the speed of downhill
The cross course that is open to the public along with the parallel run is exciting. Crosses take place on a variety of terrains, including banks, rulers, spines, and jumps.
Kroos is a combination of freestyle and downhill.
The cross course consists of 1275m, starting in the middle of the champion's slopes, crossing the Hawk 2 slope to the extreme park. It is 20% longer than the Olympic course standard 1050m, making it more thrilling.
Extreme Park, one of the cross courses
The attraction of this course is its ability to use various skills such as speed and jumping. As you fly through obstacles such as waves and jumps, you can soar as if you are flying in the sky, and you can feel as fast as a bobsleigh when you pass a sloped S-shaped bank like a velodrome in a cycle race.
Skaters Enjoying Snowboarding In Extreme Park
When flying over 10m from the last jump pad that is over adult height, even the viewer can feel the heart chewy.
A cross is played on a course consisting of various features
Be careful not to challenge yourself with motivation. You can't slow down a single moment on the entire slope, so make sure you have the right skills.
A cross is played on a course consisting of various features
It is a sport that requires physical strength to handle intense races and the skills to run a course with a lot of change.
Cross course to digest both jumps and downhill
Crosses are ranked first in the order of crossing the finish line, similar to the parallel run. Crosses play skis and snowboards. There are four ski crosses and six board crosses.
Mogle, one of the Winter Olympics courses
Test event presented by top players
If you've experienced the slopes your players want to use, don't miss the test event at Phoenix Pyeongchang. Starting February 10, a test event will be held to prepare for the PyeongChang Winter Olympics. The test event is an international competition to check the preparations before the Olympics. It's a great chance to see some of the best players in the world before the Winter Olympics. FIS Freestyle Ski World Cup (Airreal, Moggle, Halfpipe) from February 10-19, FIS Snowboard World Cup (parallel, half-pipe) from February 12-19 do. Lee Sang-ho, who emerged as the expectation of the PyeongChang Olympic Games, and Sean White, the emperor of snowboarding, will participate in this snowboarding world cup.
Phoenix Pyeongchang <Picture Credit: Phoenix Pyeongchang>

item.title: Blue waves run over Samcheok's winter sea - Samcheok, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Chuam Beach seen from Chuam-Jungsan Coastal Trail

Blue waves run over Samcheok's winter sea

Samcheok, Gangwon, South Korea

Listening to the group's blue sky song, `` Winter Seas, '' I miss the winter sea so much that I want to leave right away. I remember going to the sea long ago listening to this song. The bitter sea breeze and cold winds up the body, but the deep blue sea and the dazzling white waves dig into the chest. The winter sea meets comfort and hope more than beauty. The waters of Samcheok, Gangwon-do have the most beautiful colors and have cute beaches and coastal roads. Let's meet the winter sea along Samcheok's coastal road that leads to the coast instead of National Highway 7.

Samcheok begins, from Jeungsan Beach to Alley Beach
Samcheok's sea begins at Jeungsan Beach. Jeungsan is a village nestled between Chamjae, which leads to Chuam, and Wowsan, which passes to Samcheok Beach. The beach just over 200m ahead of the village is named Jeungsan Beach.
There is a coastal trail connecting Chuam Beach and Jeungsan Beach in the East Sea. It is a short walk of less than 300m along the coastal cliff, but it is an observation point where the landscape of candlestick rock, which is a specialty of Chuam Beach, and the surrounding rock formations unfold. If you drive by car from Jeungsan Beach to Chuam Beach, you have to travel at least 4km long.
Jeungsan Beach
Santa Rosa is the only cafe on Jeungsan Beach. You can eat as well as a variety of drinks. If you sit by the window, you can see Jeungsan Beach. It is a good place to enjoy a cup of tea while looking at the winter sea.
Santa Rosa window at Jeungsan Beach
Santa Rosa is also home to a homemade burger. From hamburger buns to patties.
Homemade burgers in Santa Rosa
In order to move from Jeungsan Beach to Samcheok Beach, you have to go over one head. When you pass from Samcheok Beach on the other side, Gwiam Park, Suwon Park and Chuam Beach are the must-see points.
Lovers on Samcheok Beach Looking at the Ocean
Samcheok Beach is visited by many Japanese. This is because Yon-sama Bae Yong-joon is the filming location for the movie Staring Out. The original name was backward beach, but changed to Samcheok beach because it was not good. The small beach that goes further south from Samcheok Beach still remains as a small backward beach.
Samcheok Beach Sculpture
There are many cafes on Samcheok Beach where you can spend a relaxing time. Among them, one cafe decorated with sky blue is outstanding. It is a sea pepe that means “a cafe in front of the beach.” The “I love you” sculpture of Samcheok Beach is directly overlooked. The interior is impressive, with two windows on the right side of the cafe, allowing me to look out through the window.
Window
Serve homemade cookies and cakes to match your coffee. Cookies and cakes made by the owner are popular with travelers looking for a buffet.
Samcheok Beach Bamp
Samcheok's representative coastal road is the Millennium Coastal Road. The road was built to commemorate the Millennium in 2000. The road along the coastal cliffs makes the landscape quite impressive. There are always coastal roads bent along the coastline, as well as cool waves that drive off the seashore and the shore. The Millennium Coastal Road runs about 5 km from Samcheok Beach to Samcheok Port.
Millennium Coastal Road and Ocean Landscape
The Beach Sculpture Park and the Tower of Hope, where you can see a variety of sculptures, serve as a shelter as well as a sunrise spot for Samcheok.
Sunrise seen from the Tower of Hope on the Millennium Coastal Road
From the center of Samcheok, Gungchon to Yonghwa Beach
When you exit the Millennium Coastal Road, you will see National Highway 7 toward Uljin. Follow Samcheok-ro instead of National Highway 7, which is like an expressway at Obun Intersection. Samcheok-ro, the old national road, is the way to meet Samcheok's most beautiful seas, from Alley, Gungchon, Munam, Chogok, Yonghwa, and Jangho Beach to Gopo, the southern edge of Samcheok.
Gungchon to Yonghwa is a famous section for marine rail bikes. Rail bikes are famous, but few people find coastal roads from Gungchon to Yonghwa Beach. Crossing Gungchon Bridge, you will find coastal roads leading to Wonpyeong Beach, Munam Beach and Chogok Port. The road runs alongside marine rail bikes. As you approach Chogok Harbor, you can see the observation deck on the rocks. It is worth noting because there is a bow-shaped Moonam beach, the surrounding sea rocks, Chogok Harbor Breakwater, and a rock that resembles a Maison Samjon Buddha with a coffin.
Maison Samjonbul Rock on Munam Beach
Chogok Port is the home of Montjuic's hero, Marathoner Hwang Young-jo. Overlooking Chogok Port in Hwang Yeong-jo Memorial Park, set on the hill of the village.
Chogok Port, the hometown of Hwang Young-jo, the hero of Montjuic
From Chogok Port to Yonghwa Beach, there is more than one big pass. It is also known as mal soup. Malgukjae Summit is the best view point of Samcheok overlooking Yonghwa Beach and Jangho Port. Horses carry people and roll their feet against the seascape. The scenery is as beautiful as the legend this winter.
Yonghwa Beach and Jangho Port from the Top
Samcheok's Edge, from Galam to Gopo Village
Galnam Port is a secluded fishing village located south of Jangho Port. At one time, many ships gathered to be the mother port of Taichung fishing boats, but now it is just a fishing village. Before you enter Galang Port, take a look around the roadside deck. There is nothing beautiful about Wolmido, Gaetbawi Rock, calm blue sea, Galnam Port and village scenery. The water in the harbor is also transparent enough to see the bottom.
Galnam Port with Beautiful Water and Village
If you go down the path from Galnam Port, you will pass through Haesindang Park to the officers. Behind the executive port is the Nambu Volcano Hunhwa Park. There is a small road leading to Namhwa Volcano just before the officers' office. The road to the top of the park is also difficult. It is a narrow cement road that reaches 2.5km and is very steep. But if you reach the top as hard as you can, the open sea is waiting for you. The promenade is made with various sculptures based on the story in Samguk Yusa.
Sculpture of Waterway Women's Memorial Park
Passing officers is Wondeok-eup, the last home of Samcheok. As soon as you cross the Wolcheon Bridge from Wondeok-eup to Hosan Intersection, turn left and follow the Gigokcheon Stream, which leads to Wolcheon Beach and Gopo Village. Across from Gigokcheon, a huge gray structure catches the eye. LNG production base is located. Side by side with the gray structure, Sol Island, famous for being photographed by British photographer Michael Kenna. As the LNG production base enters, only Solsum remains, but the surrounding area is desolate. It is even more sorrowful than ever when the LNG production base enters Solseom, which was at the center of the legal battle against Michael Kenna's photographic copyright issue.
Solseom on the way to Wolcheon Beach
Passing Wolcheon Beach, you will reach Gopo Village, the end of Samcheok and the beginning of Uljin. North is Wolcheon-ri, Wondeok-eup, Samcheok-si, and Nagok-ri, Buk-myeon, Uljin-gun. Area codes are different and each polling place is different when dialing one street. It is a place where you can feel a special feeling even though there is no special sight.
Gopo Village
Dohwasan Garden, behind Gopo Village, is a park that has planted barren trees, which are colored in pink during summer, in the ruins of a forest fire. On top of the park are gazebos and benches. Here you can see the national highway No. 7 that connects the East Sea and North and South.
View from Dohwa Garden

item.title: Bang Tae-san Natural Recreation Forest - Inje-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Fall of Bangtae Mountain

Bang Tae-san Natural Recreation Forest

Inje-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

Bang Tae-san is a natural beauty when hit by humans. Often, when you meet a beauty, you can't even know 'wow' and admiration comes out. This is the case with Bang Tae-san. My heart beats up and down the moment I see it. If you ask for a night in the backcountry landscape, you will dream of autumn leaves.
Two-stage waterfall and autumnal world
The road to see the beauty is long and rough. After exiting the expressway from Donghongcheon IC, the remaining distance for navigation is 61km. The vagueness that there is a place where you have to run an hour and a half after getting off the expressway in the times when the highway stretches up and down for a while, grabs the handle and enjoys the excitement toward the back country. The closer you get to Mt. Taetae, the farther it is from the expressway. On the side of the winding road, the descending river and Bangdong Valley spread out the pristine landscape. While immersed in the scenery, we arrive at Bangtaesan Natural Recreation Forest ticket office without any boredom.
The maple leaves greet you first
Did you say 'land from heaven, Inje'? On the way to the campsite past the ticket booth, people who are so close to this beautiful landscape begin to spring. The foliage is lined up on both sides of the street to welcome.
Valley colored with autumn leaves
At the ticket booth, you'll be welcomed by the maple trees. It is the most beloved place in Bangtaesan Natural Recreation Forest. In particular, in autumn, the heresy falls to the point of performing orchestras. The main character on the stage decorated with colorful autumn leaves is a waterfall that falls to heresy. In front of the stage is a crowd of clouds. He constantly presses the camera shutter toward the main character who unfolds a white thread in heresy. Similar to the airport where the idol star appeared.
Ethanol Falls, a trademark of Bangtaesan Natural Recreation Forest
A waterfall of 10m and 3m high water falls into heresy and the collaborative performance of the maple forest that surrounds it are the works of the gods that fascinate. Wash away the old thoughts fluttering in the sound of the cool water and be a romantic lover of the pieces of autumn leaves.
Falls and Falls
Even if you're not a photographer, you can put a picture of a two-level waterfall with autumn leaves in your chest.
Scenery to put in the chest
Go a little further past the campsite from heresy falls to the forest exploration trail. The Forest Experience Trail, which starts from the parking lot above the 2nd Campsite, is a promenade that allows you to appreciate the unexplored mountains of Bangtae Mountain. It's only 2km away, so a slow pace of 1 hour is enough. But it's not just an hour. It is an hour to admire interjection all along the walk.
Forest Experience Trail with Foliage Tunnels
Autumn in Jeokgargol is the world of autumn leaves. The first step on the promenade makes you feel as if you are in a different world. It is a waste to walk the scenery where the pure valley like the ancient times is colored with red leaves. Even if you walk slowly, you want to walk more slowly.
1 hour of autumn leaves along the forest trail
If you like to hike, you can walk all the way to the sum peak. The hiking trail that leads to Maebong-ryeong, Guryongdeok-bong, and Jueumbong-bong takes 10.2km and takes about 6 hours.
Visitors who can't leave their enemies
Join the forest commentary at 10 am every day to get closer to nature. At 2 pm, there will be a woodworking experience to make pencil holders and key chains.
Forest Commentary and Woodworking Experience
Holy Land of Camping in Autumn
For those who enjoy camping, spending a night at Bangtaesan Natural Recreation Forest with beautiful autumn leaves is a wish that you want to achieve once. The campsite sits in a maple forest next to the valley, so where is the better place? It is the land of Bae-pung-byeong, which is comparable to the name of Baesan-byeong. When you open the tent door, clear water flows through the pristine valley, and as you look up, the forest of burning autumn leaves spreads out.
Campsite for dream camping under the foliage forest
The camping site is divided into the first camping site across from the resort and the second camping site past the two-stage waterfall. There are a total of 50 decks, 10 at the 1st campsite and 40 at the 2nd campsite. The first campsite is better for relatively quiet camping. The second campsite is close to the two-tier waterfall and forest trail, which is good for walking around the autumn leaves.
Campground morning with colored leaves
The deck size is relatively small, 3.6m × 3.7m and 3.6m × 3.0m, so minimalist camping is suitable. There are three bathrooms and two kitchens, and one shower room is located at the second campsite. You can't park your car right next to the tent, but it's relatively close, so it's a good idea for auto camping. It is a pity that there is no hot water and electric facilities, but as it is a camping nearer to nature, it lasts for a long time. Warm sleeping bags are essential at this time of year when the temperature drops sharply.
Tents under the autumn leaves
There is a house in the forest and a forest culture and recreation center where you can enjoy a night in the autumn leaves without camping. In the forest house there is one 12 person room of 83m2, and the forest culture and recreation hall in the form of tenement houses has four 5 ~ 6 person rooms of 29㎡ and five 6 ~ 8 person rooms of 39㎡. There are small attic rooms for six to eight people who need to climb a ladder. Reservations can be made on the National Natural Recreation Forest website. However, Tuesday is closed.
Cooking at the campsite
If you had a honey-like night at Bangtaesan Recreation Forest, it's time to take a tour of the attractions of Inje. First of all, it is 5 minutes away. Because of its high carbonate content, sugar is famous for its delicious cider. Bear Beard, famous for its wildflowers, is 40 minutes away and Park In-hwan Literature Museum is an hour away. You can not miss the one-handed birch forest. The birch grove, called “Aristocracy of the Forest,” is an exotic landscape where visitors from all seasons line up.
Forest Culture Recreation Center

item.title: Chick chunky ~! Samcheok summer trip to train theme park, beautiful east coast scenery is a bonus! - Samcheok, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
High1 Chuchu Park Switchback Train <Photo courtesy of High1 Chuchu Park>

Chick chunky ~! Samcheok summer trip to train theme park, beautiful east coast scenery is a bonus!

Samcheok, Gangwon, South Korea

Summer wants to leave everyday. Gangwon-do, famous for its picturesque seascape, offers a unique train trip to Samcheok. The Swiss Mountain Train Incline, a switchback that has now disappeared into history, the mini train, a miniature train scaled down from the world's most famous trains, and one of the nation's fastest rail bikes. Chupark is the main character.
Samcheok High Wonchu Park (hereafter Chuchu Park) is located in the shed is closer to Taebaek than Samcheok. Therefore, to travel to Samcheok, including Chuchu Park must catch the line. This is true even if you stay at Chuchu Park.
Incline train to experience the Swiss Jungfrau mountain train
If you visit Samcheok during the vacation season, how about adding some time to cool down while looking at the cool East Sea. Let's add Haesindang Park, Madam Hunhwa Park, and Samcheok Sol Beach Aqua World around Chuchu Park.
It is made on the section of the railway and takes you to Sky Station
From the Swiss mountain trains to the switchback train of memories, High Cone Chu Park
Chuchu Station welcomes you when you reach Korea's first train theme park or Chuchu Park. Let's take a look at the four trains (incline, rail coaster, mini train and switchback) you can experience here. It also has cozy accommodation, so travelers with children can enjoy it.
Swiss mountain train, Incline train <Photo courtesy of High1 Chuchu Park>
The Swiss mountain train Incline train is the first thing that catches your eye. It is the only Swiss-style mountain train in Korea that rebuilds the railway that was demolished in 1963 and climbs up and down an altitude of 200m and over 15 degrees. Steel Railroad is a railway made in 1993 to overcome the altitude difference between Samcheok Symphony and Taebaek Tongli. The 15.6-degree sloping track made of the altitude difference pulled up the train. To put it simply, think of a steep uphill train. People walked around.
Tongli Station
The incline train at High Cone Chuchu Park was reconstructed from a section of the railway that was demolished in 1963. 10 minutes up the incline train to reach the Skystation at an altitude of 720 meters. He hears the wind blowing from Baekdudaegan from the observatory and comes back to Chuchu Station. You have to take a shuttle bus to take the rail coaster.
Rail coaster between Chuchu Station and Tongli Station
Rail Coaster. It's a common rail bike we go down the hill at 25km per hour. Unlike other rail bikes, the rail coaster runs down the 12 tunnels, so you only need to pedal for the first few minutes and the brakes are good for the rest. Although rattling, it's a relatively comfortable rail bike with legs and mind. In addition to the switchback, reservations must be made for popular trains at High One Chuchu Park.
High1 Chuchu Park base camp, Chuchu Station panoramic view
The following is a miniature train and mini train made by miniature foreign trains. As its name suggests, it's small and mesmerizing.
Popular among children, minitrain
Slowly run around Chuchu Station for 10-15 minutes at 3km per hour. After you experience the mini train, don't forget to take photos in the photo zone.
Popular among children, minitrain
Finally switchback train. It is a railroad made of “Galji” in order to operate a train on a sloped mountain range. I went forward, went back and climbed the mountain. It takes about 100 minutes from Chuchu Station to Dogye Station. Switchback trains are also popular and reservations are a must.
Tracks on the train switchback train going back
There are 4 types of lodgings in Hiwonchu Park where you can experience 4 types of trains. Natureville is a single villa, Cubeville with grass on the roof, Trainville with train, and auto camping ground. Natureville and Cubeville are family units, and Trainville is for two people. The price is quite high, but it can be used at relatively low prices in social, except for the polar season. Food and drinks are sold next to Chuchu Station. During peak season and weekend evenings, there is a barbecue party at Chuchu Station.
100-minute round-trip switchback train
Samcheok's shores at a glance
Now it's time to feel Samcheok's sea. Let's start from Hunhwa Park, the southernmost part of the Samcheok coast. It is at the end of the executive port which is highly recommended for those who want to eat thick sashimi in Samcheok.
Ascending the promenade, you can see Chuam Candlestick Rock.
The waterway wife Hunhwa Park, as the name suggests, tells the story of the waterway wife in <Hunhwaga> and the dragon in <Seascape>. The park is reborn with a sultry tale that is so dark that an old man picks flowers on a cliff.
Statue of Mrs. Hunhwa Park
The elevator goes up to the beginning of the park. It is better to avoid the day when it is too bright because you have to walk out of the elevator. The majestic gynecologic dragon sculpture with the backdrop of the sea is magnificent.
Panoramic view of Mrs. Hunhwa Park
Haesindang Park, which is similar to the Hunhwa Park, is also a must-see. It is an interesting place where you can get a glimpse of the idea of phallic worship, which has a legend that appeases the maiden who died in the sea waiting for a bachelor who promised marriage. The penis is located here and there in the sea, and it just laughs because it's not dismal and decadent. Use the sense of adding or subtracting according to the travel companion or the nature of the trip.
Jangho Port is the first to come to Samcheok's beautiful coast
If you're traveling by young couples or families who want to be active, marine rail bikes to and from Gungchon Station and Yonghwa Station located in the middle of Samcheok coast are fine. It operates 5 times a day from Gungchon Station (09:00, 10:30, 13:00, 14:30, 16:00) and 10 minutes from Yonghwa Station. The rail bike is a one-way shuttle bus, not a round trip. It operates at night (17:30) during peak season, weekends and holidays.
Marine Rail Bike between Gungchon Station and Yonghwa Station
If you go further north, Samcheok is a newly opened Daemyung Resort last year. The blue-roofed building is located on the waterfront, creating an exotic landscape like Santorini. It also has a state-of-the-art water park and Aqua World. Not far from here, the Chuam Candlestick Rock unfolds behind the deck connecting Samcheok and the East Sea.
Samcheok Sol Beach Aqua World
TIP. Samcheok High1 Chuchu Park

Contact: 033-550-7788
Fee for the experience facility: Rail Coaster 4 passengers 35,000 won, 2 passengers 28,000 won, mini train 4,000 won. 10,000 won round trip for switchback train

item.title: 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 07, an expedition into pristine nature - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Eomchi Village

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 07, an expedition into pristine nature

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
Eulchima Village and Pyeongchang-dong River Freshwater Fish Ecological Center

→ Baengryong Cave → Donggang Rafting → Byeolmaro Astronomical Observatory

The journey to meet primitive nature runs from Dongtan to Pyeongchang-gun from Mitan-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun, which is also considered a remote place in Gangwon-do. The enormous nature created by nature and refined by time impresses us infinitely. The wonders felt in Baekryong Cave, and the achievements of tasting through rough waters in the Donggang, are all gifts from nature. Many stars, filled with the night sky as if it's going to pour, give a little bit of excitement and present a precious time to look back on themselves.
Mittan-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun is one of the most remote areas in Gangwon-do There is a village where you can meet 20 minutes by car. The name is also a beautiful village. Pyeongchang-dong River Freshwater Fish Ecological Center is located at the beginning of Eulchi village, which is famous for ecotourism. When you enter the ecological hall, a cave model that is modeled after Baekryong Cave welcomes travelers. It is a space where you can meet the contents of the White Dragon Cave through sound and visual exhibits.
The Freshwater Fish Nature Museum, which exhibits freshwater fish in the East River, is the core space of the Pyeongchang-dong Freshwater Fish Ecological Center. There are 46 kinds of freshwater fish such as eojichi, oxeye and gorge. The catfish, which hides a huge body of 1.2m in the gap between the rocks, is a place for freshwater fish.
Pyeongchang-dong River Freshwater Fish Ecological Center
If the exhibition hall on the first floor is a viewing space, the second floor exhibition hall consisting of a fish exploration hall and a Donggang experience hall is a space for experience. Watching the live-action video on the big screen, the rafting experience over the rugged waters of the river is as thrilling as riding a roller coaster. You can catch fish with your bare hands at the outdoor experience hall connected to the exhibition hall on the second floor. After looking around the ecology hall, you can try various sports such as rafting, kayaking, skyline, sky jumping, etc.
1.2m long native catfish
White Dragon Cave (Natural Monument No. 260) was opened to the public as it was designated as an ecological learning cave in 2010. It has been 30 years since it was known to the world by villagers in 1976. Baekryong Cave has become the representative ecotourism destination of Pyeongchang, which is visited by 10,000 people every year within 6 years of cave opening.
Take a boat to the entrance to Baeryong Cave
Baekryong Cave visit begins with a change of clothes. If you bring your helmet, head lantern, gloves and boots, you're ready to visit. The reason why you need a visitor's suit is found in the cave. Go to the cave entrance by boat. The distance that once had to walk 40 minutes along the iron railings has been reduced to 10 minutes. The huge rock that meets the cave entrance is Ondol. Even after more than 1700 years, there are still traces of fire burned in the firewood under the ondol.
White Dragon Cave Entrance
The trail is rougher than I thought. In a lightless cave, the head lantern on the helmet is the only guide. Narrow trails are also embarrassing. Hitting the head against the ceiling because the sight of the helmet is obscured, there are several sections where you can keep walking by bending your waist 90 degrees to the suddenly lowered ceiling.
Ondol trail remaining at the entrance of Baekyong Cave
There is a section where the hips are attached to the ground and slide down, while there is a 'dog hole' that can be difficult to pass by waiting on the floor.
Some sections are narrow enough to crawl in
Only after exploring more than exploration did the white dragon cave reveal its deep inside. Stylized stalactites suspended from the ceiling like icicles, staggering towering stalagmites, and giant stalagmites where stalactites and stalagmites meet. The strange shape of the cave retains its original beauty. Pride egg-shaped stalagmite, which can be used as a camera lens if processed well, is the best among them. When you reach the end of the cave, you'll be able to turn off all the lights and have a special experience facing the dark.
Stalactites decorating the cave wall
The publicly-disclosed section of Baekyong Cave, which stretches for 1.8km, is A course 785m away. It takes about 2 hours and 40 minutes to visit the cave with a guide from the reservation and the number of visitors is limited to 240 people per day.
You can observe various stalagmite stalactites in Baekyong Cave.
Children under 9 years old and elderly people over 65 are not allowed to visit for safety reasons.
Stalactite in the form of a pipe organ
If you follow the Donggang River from Baekyong Cave, it leads to Yeongwol. In summer, Donggang is a rafting paradise. The representative rafting course is 12km from Munsan Naruter to Subsenaruter. It is the best course where you can enjoy thrill and pleasure at the same time as the rapids and the smooth water are mixed. Good luck in facing hidden secrets of Donggang, including Eorayeon, is a bonus. Eorayeon, one of Yeongwol 8 sights, is also the 14th scenic spot.
Donggang Rafting
The start of rafting is safety education. Over 30 minutes, you will learn how to use your paddle and learn how to handle emergencies. It is also important to get acquainted with water. 'Unification of spirit' 'We are one' is the best way to get acquainted with water to remind us of military training. Both the security guards who give up the spirit and the experienced visitors who receive the spirit are both happy and playful. One person is aboard the boat in response to the safety signals. The front of the boat is the strongest member of the team, and the back is the safety guard.
Warm-up exercises are essential before you start rafting
one two! one two! The success of rafting is in unity. All the passengers must paddle like a body in line with the command so that the boat will go in the desired direction. In the East River, where the rapids and the level are often reversed, you can't relax even for a while.
Enjoy the scenery of the east river effortlessly
The rush of water that has been driving roughly becomes mild as it passes by. Now, it is time to experience the highlight of Yeongwol rafting, Donggang Falls, which we only heard in words. Donggang Falls, as its name suggests, is a special event that jumps from boat to Donggang. If you dare to throw a boat or a river from the rock, the summer heat is already receding.
It's even more fun to meet the torrents
Once you enter Yeongwol along the Donggang River, it is time to finish the day. There is no place like Yeongwol Byeolcho Observatory to organize a day spent in nature. It is the third oldest observatory in our country, equipped with an observation room, an auxiliary observation room, and an astronomical projection room. Astro observation is divided into day observation and night observation. Observing sunspots and redness of the sun during the day and the moon at night. Astrophysical observations follow the observation of the sun, moon and planets in the secondary observation room, followed by observations of nebulae and galaxies. The assistant observation room of Byeolmaro Astronomical Observatory is the best observatory that can not only observe the celestial bodies but also the city of Yeongwol and Donggang at a glance.
View from Byeolmaro Observatory
Solar observations use astronomical telescopes equipped with special filters and round iron plates looking at sunspots. Observation of the sun's redness through the telescope's finder and the sunspots attached are identified by images on a round iron plate. It is surprising that sunspots that are smaller than the clear dust on the iron plate are many times larger than the earth. The most common thing in night observations is the moon. Depending on the atmosphere, planets like Jupiter can be observed, but there are not many opportunities.
Byeolmaro Observatory Astronomical Projection Room
The astronomical projection room is a space where you can look again at the celestial body seen from the observation room. You can see the celestial bodies filled with dome screens, find seasonal constellations, and hear interesting stories about the Milky Way connecting the weaver and the friendly. How to find the North Star by the location of the Big Dipper is a bonus.
In the VR experience room on the 2nd floor of the observatory, you can experience the exhilarating experience as if you are actually paragliding through realistic VR images. In Byeolmaro Astronomical Observatory, two teams conduct astronomical observation five times a day from 3:30 pm to 30 minutes.
Byeolmaro Observatory VR Experience Room

traditional market
Pyeongchangbong Flat
A marketplace that opens at the buckwheat's local peak. You can taste buckwheat noodles such as buckwheat noodles, buckwheat pancake, buckwheat jelly, and buckwheat nabi bibimbap. item.title: Wild Grassland, Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Plenty of grass in the sky ranch

Wild Grassland, Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

It is an exotic place with windy generators, wide meadows, low hills, and unspoiled mountain ranges over 1,000 meters above sea level. If you go there, you can relax with Sinab. Daegwallyeong sky ranch.
In late summer, when you go to Pyeongchang, you can enjoy the Hyoseok Culture System in the buckwheat flower fields that are white and enjoy the wide meadows of the ranch.
Great meadow to ride horses
40 years of hidden wilderness
On September 1, 2014, a large ranch was opened to the public in 40 years. It is the Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch, which was known to Daegwallyeong Hanil Farm. Opening the ranch changed its name.
Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch with Fun and Ride
The sky ranch, surrounded by Daegwallyeong Samyang Ranch, boasts a vast grassland that is four times larger than Yeouido. Since 1974, it has been defending Daegwallyeong along with Samyang Ranch, but it only functions as a dairy cow ranch, and has never been made public for tourism purposes. Recently refurbished and opened for the first time, unveiled.
Sky Ranch with various walks and walkways
A ranch official introduces Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch as a nature-compliant ecological ranch where visitors can experience nature directly. It literally means to exclude artificial ones as much as possible and to feel and experience the nature of the ranch. The facilities and nature trails were also eco-friendly so that people could have more intimate contact with the ecology and nature of the ranch. Thus, unlike other ranches, they minimized the installation of fences and did not install separate wooden decks on the trails.
Sky Ranch with various walks and walkways
The ecological environment of the ranch, which has been well preserved for the past 40 years, attracts travelers. Dozens of species of wild flowers and rare plants grow wild throughout the ranch. Depending on the season, native plants such as helm flowers, roe deer, bee vines, primroses, irises and widower flowers form a cluster of places.
Sky Ranch Wildflower Paradise
Walk, ride and run through the meadow
At Sky Ranch, all vehicles except ambulances are restricted. This is also different from the nearby ranch. You can park your car in the parking lot and walk slowly or enjoy the meadow in a different way.
If you are tired of the forest and enjoy the vast meadows, we recommend walking. Sky Ranch has four different trails, depending on the theme. 1.8km of 'Landscape Landscape' resembling a pilgrimage route in Santiago with lots of grassland, 2.2km 'Edge Forest Road' leading to Seonjaryeong, 350m 'Forest Summer Road' where trees in the forest tunnel, and rare plants and wildflowers It is a 600m 'often walking path'. You might want to take a nap while buried in the grass that rises to your knees. A mat is a place for picnics everywhere.
Tractor Carriage to Sky Mara Observatory <Photo courtesy of Sky Ranch>

If you want to enjoy the ranch, you can use a tractor carriage. A 32-seater, wagon pulled by tractors carries visitors to the Skyscrapers Observatory. If you take a carriage for 20 minutes from the entrance, you will reach the observatory. From the observatory, you can see not only the ranch view, but also the view of Hoengye-eup, nearby resorts and ski jumps. From the observation deck, it is also connected to Seonyeong-ryeong, which is famous for Daegwallyeong trekking course. You can also enjoy the beautiful Seonyeongreak trekking in the cozy wild forest.

Sheep Grazing <Photo courtesy of Sky Ranch>
You can enjoy meadows on horseback as if you were a nomad in Mongolia. If you have horse riding experience, you can go out on the grassland for 2-4 hours. The person who leads this experience is a Mongolian young man who speaks Korean well enough to be misunderstood as a Korean. Even if you don't have to go to Mongolia, it is a fresh experience to ride the grassland while listening to Mongolian life. If you've never rode a horse, you can go horseback riding on a flat track.
32 Seater Tractor Carriage Circling the Sky Ranch
If you go to the flocks field at the beginning of the ranch, you can go inside the fence and jump with the flocks. At the baby zoo, you can also feed calf, foal, and baby sheep. Straw grass field and grass field are both natural playgrounds where you can roll around and jump freely.
Carriage tour with short description
In September, into the white buckwheat field
Every September, Pyeongchang Hyoseok Cultural Festival was held in Hyoseok Village, Bongpyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun.
Buckwheat field where Pyeongchang Hyoseok Cultural Festival is held
Here, you can fully enjoy autumn in the white buckwheat field of Bongpyeong, which is the stage of the novel <When Buckwheat Flower Fills>. The buckwheat field is as spectacular as day or night.
Buckwheat field where Pyeongchang Hyoseok Cultural Festival is held
You can feel the whole sentence of the novel, “The hillside is a buckwheat field, and the flowers that start to bloom are choked by the dim moonlight.
Buckwheat field where Pyeongchang Hyoseok Cultural Festival is held
You can also enjoy various experiences and performances at Hyoseok Culture Village. In addition to riding donkeys, making soba noodles and sticking glutinous rice cakes, you can also participate in cravings and literary creation classes. In the event hall, the marketplace is recreated, and there are many folk games, street performances, and courtyard play.
Soba with soba
At night, the movie "When Buckwheat Peel" is screened. You can spend a romantic time with the buckwheat blossoms in the moonlight. Various buckwheat dishes made with 100% domestic buckwheat are a bonus.
Soba Buckwheat Noodles

Pyeongchang Hyoseok Cultural Festival is a cultural festival that is perfect for those who want to feel the scent of early autumn literature.

Enjoy buckwheat dishes made with 100% domestic buckwheat

item.title: 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 05, Green Road along green meadows - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
View from Alpensia Ski Jump

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 05, Green Road along green meadows

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>

Alpensia Ski Jumping Team →→ Daegwanryeong Sky Ranch → Anvandegi Unyu-gil →→ Yunyu Village

From Pyeongchang Daegwallyeong, Gangneung's journey is full of green. The skies that make you look at the ski observatory and the sky ranch where the sun shines as transparent as a child's smile are all green. Thick greens were formed on the cabbage leaves of the young bed bug, which barely made its way through the low clouds.
Alpensia Ski Jumping University, which was established for the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, made its name public with the movie <National Representative>. The ridge with Alpensia ski jump is 850 meters above sea level. It is about 100m higher than the lower ground with the stands. You have to climb 69m to the observatory again, so the total height is close to 1,000m. Of course, only when the sea level as a base is dizzy.
Alpensia Ski Jumping Slope
Ski jumping stage viewing is divided into general viewing, which includes only the observation deck, and special viewing including the K98 ski jumping stage. The admission fee is 2,000 won for general visit and 6,000 won for special visit.
Alpensia Ski Jumping Monorail Upper Boarding Point
The K98 Ski Jumping Team has been open to the public since April 2015. The view is an art only in the 25m high K98 ski jump. Mount Balwang and Gorupogi spread out like a panorama. As well as the view, the passage between the waiting room and the start line is also a specialty. It is made of lattice reinforcement to prevent snow from accumulating, so it looks down 25m. It feels like you're walking on a skywalk covered with tempered glass. Be careful not to drop your phone or wallet.
Ski jumping practice scene of athletes
If you take the elevator to the observation deck, your view becomes wider. It's great to sit in the lounge cafe and enjoy a cup of coffee, or to enjoy the alpine law of Pyeongchang.
Ski jumping practice scene of athletes
The 11-seater monorail climbs from the sports park main stadium to the ski jump entrance. Groups can also use the car. The monorail runs every 30 minutes from 9:25 am. If you visit early in the morning, you can see the players practicing.
Alpensia Ski Jumping Observatory
Don't miss the Daegwallyeong skiing history building on the first floor of the main stadium. From the story of Uru, the god of skiing in Icelandic myths, to the modern age, this is a space where you can examine the development of skiing by age. Traditional skis made of wood and straw snow are also interesting.
Daegwallyeong Ski History Museum
Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch is a nature-compliant ecological ranch. By minimizing man-made facilities, nature and people, people and animals are designed to blend naturally. More than four times more than Yeouido, grassland is full of green. It's thrilling just to step into the transparent scenery resembling the summer sunshine.
Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch spread out like a carpet
Tractor carriages make it easier to get around the ranch. The huge wagon pulled by the tractor makes a round trip through the ranch through the Skytop Observatory. You can reach the observation deck in 15 minutes by car. From the observation deck, you can see the view of the ranch and Hoengye-eup. You can also walk slowly from the observation deck to the top of Seonryeongryeong. This 1.8km long road is called the Scenic Landscape. There are many beautiful trekking courses in the sky ranch, including 'edge forest trail', 'forest trails' and 'jongjong walking trail'. Tractor wagons run flexibly depending on the number of visitors.
Cow pasture
There is a lot of space in the sky ranch to hang out with the animals. Representatives include a baby zoo where baby animals such as calves, foals and lambs are gathered, and a sheep farm where you can experience hay cycle in the flock. You can experience hay cycle in both places. The sheep herd is operated organically depending on the condition of the sheep. Horseback riding is an indispensable experience of Sky Ranch. Horse riding experience is available for anyone over the age of 7 to ride a round track on horseback. Equestrian trekking on horseback walks through the forest trails of the sky ranch. Horse trekking is available on a advance reservation basis only for those who can ride the canter.
Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch filled with green light
Anbandong is a Gangneung dialect of Anbanduk. Anban refers to a wooden board that is used as a base for baking bread. It is named after the rugged Baekdudaegan stem, which is like a rice cake and is rich in terrain. Anbandongi, located at an altitude of 1100m, is the highest village inhabited by Koreans. 195 ha of farmland is spread in the shape of an eagle wing with Okneungbong and Mt. Gorupogi on the left and right. In 1995, farmers bought land that had been allowed to be reclaimed from state land and leased to Hwajeon people. If the rice paddy field shows an aspect of the hard life of the seashore people, the Anbandi highland field is a miracle created by the sweat and efforts of the Chinese people.
Anbandongi Sunrise
Early settlers cultivated rough stones in slopes with only pickaxes and shovels. The result of the stacked stone is the yoke observatory. It is a space filled with the spirit of pioneering and pioneering spirit of a group of Hwajeon people. If you turn to the right at the crossroads that are 300 meters above Unyuchon Parking Lot, you will see Yoke Observatory.
Andangigi Milk Road
The entire 6km Anbandigi Unyugil must walk slowly like clouds flowing through the wind. You don't have to walk fast. The path that begins at the bottom of the mountain builds up one by one, one after another, to the hillside and back to the summit. The higher the road, the wider the view. The cabbages that have not yet grown by the way are neat.
Anbandongi Unyugil Highland Cabbage Field
Standing in the heliport under Okneungbong, the blue water of the East Sea dimly behind the meandering cabbage field. From the heliport, the sunrise observatory leads to Unyuchon, the starting point, along the ridge flowing smoothly. The Anbandigi Unyu-gil is the origin return course, so you can return to the Yunyu village no matter which direction you take.
Andangigi Milk Road
Yunyu Village is the head of Anbandigi Unyu-gil. It is too small to call it a village. All three houses are next to the town hall. It is a space used as a restaurant and accommodation. The empty lot in front of the lodge and restaurant, called Unyu Store, is the only public parking lot in Unyu Village. Narrow bus lanes make it difficult for large buses, but the youngest car can be parked. The two lodges were named Unyu-woo and Unyu-taek respectively. If the road of cloud flows, the cloud and cloud will be the house where the cloud rests.
Yunyu Village
Both places have the appearance of you and the house where Hwajeonmin lived. The interior is as clean as any pension. There is a living room and bedroom and a bathroom with shower. Kitchen facilities are perfect. The fun thing is Agung, which is reproduced as it was. Although there is a boiler, it is a space where you can cook rice or cook potatoes or sweet potatoes in a cauldron placed on a fire.
Unyuchon in the shape of a house
The Hwajeon Minryo Museum, which is also a canteen, is located at a crossroads 300 meters above Unyuchon Parking Lot. You can take a look at the life of the Koreans in the 1970s and 1980s.
Unyuchon Hwajeon Folk Museum
Travel info

Recommended travel season: summer and autumn

Recommended trip: family, friends

http://www.gpfestival.kr/


traditional market
Pyeongchangbong Flat
A marketplace that opens at the buckwheat's local peak. You can taste buckwheat noodles such as buckwheat noodles, buckwheat pancake, buckwheat jelly, and buckwheat nabi bibimbap. There is a wide buckwheat flower garden nearby, and the water mill is a great place to enjoy a walk while enjoying the native mood.

item.title: "Come, is this the first time in Pyeongchang Bakery?" Pyeongchang Winter Olympics D-100, Pyeongchang Bread Flavor - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Local Food Cafe 'Coro Bay'

"Come, is this the first time in Pyeongchang Bakery?" Pyeongchang Winter Olympics D-100, Pyeongchang Bread Flavor

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

Not long ago a mail came from Canada. Pennies, Caroline and Janice, who live in Vancouver, visit Korea this winter. To see the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics. Also different from those who live in winter sports. I came to Korea to see the Winter Olympics… .
As a result, November 1 is the day of the D-100 Winter Olympics. It felt so far, but it is not too long now. After receiving mail from my friends, I also prepared to welcome guests. I picked a list of places to visit and things to see and do in Pyeongchang.
Vegetarian Bakery 'Nanda Bakery'
Once you decide what to eat, the guidebook is complete! What do you eat? The famous Sanchae meal, Osam Bulgogi, Hanwoo grilled, and buckwheat dishes are good in Pyeongchang. A few years ago, there weren't many bakeries that stood out.
Bread made with buckwheat
But what a girl. Last week I went to Pyeongchang for exploration and autumn leaves and found some bakeries I would like to show off to my foreign friends. Eureka! I want to brag to my kids soon. Three people three colors, Pyeongchang bakery list to shoot their tastes are released.
Type A: Vegan interested in trekking and cultural heritage → Nanda Bakery
Penny always enjoys trekking in Canada. A naturalist and healthist, she is a vegetarian who likes to walk in the mountains. It is the most vegan of any vegetarian diet. Vegan doesn't eat meat, or dairy products like eggs, milk, and cheese. I found the perfect place for her. It is 'Nanda Bakery' located in Odaesan Woljeongsa. Since it is a temple operated by thorough vegetarianism. Do not use butter, milk or eggs at all. Organic wheat flour and domestic whole wheat are used, and other ingredients are selected with domestic priority.
Elegant bakery in Woljeongsa
Nanda and bakery bread is made tricky. First of all, it is operated by a large temple called Woljeongsa Temple. Since the monk must be edible bread, it is based on the principle of temple food. Make bread that is beneficial to your body rather than deceptive bread and focus on honest and healthy tastes rather than profits. The bread maker also puts healthy bread first. He has been in the baking industry for a long time, and he is more sensitive to bread ingredients because he suffers from atopy and skin allergies. Also his wife is vegan. As the couple make bread that they can eat, they are bound to be more thorough.
Don't use milk, eggs, or butter
Nandana Bakery is simple. Not many kinds of bread come out in one day. The bread is not gorgeous either. The ingredients for bread are also simple. Release materials one by one with confidence. The bread is more faithful to the inside than the outer packaging. You can see just one soboro bread. There are many hands, but you can also make toppings with sobo. Mix ground peanut and pistachios with coconut oil. It's very different from ordinary soboro bread toppings made with butter, peanut butter, sugar and eggs.
Kindly tell me the ingredients for the bread
This is the case for all breads in Nanda and Bakery. Healthy and delicious breads, such as cakes made with vegetarian cream, home-grown red beans and red bean bread made from fermented yeast. Next to the bakery is a cafe and a cafe. You can buy bread and eat it with a drink at a tea house or cafe. The fine mountain landscape is a bonus. Penny is sure to be surprised that there is such a nice bakery in the mountains of Gangwon-do.
Bread seasoned with healthy and honest ingredients
<Fun next to bakery> Odaesan Woljeongsa & Seonjae-gil
Nanda bakery is attractive enough for the vegetarian penny, but the surroundings are a bonus. It adds a quiet promenade to the landscape of Korean mountain temple that foreigners will love. In the mountain sheltered courtyard, there is a octagonal pagoda of Pyeongchang Woljeongsa, National Treasure No. 48-1. The mountain, the temple, and the tower are combined to complete an oriental painting.
Autumn landscape in Woljeongsa
If you walk to the fir forest road and Seonjae-gil, you will be ecstatic. The 9km-long Seonjae-gil, which runs from Woljeongsa Temple to Sangwonsa Temple, is beautiful in autumn with beautiful colored leaves. So even during the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, you can enjoy the charm.
Seonjae-gil in autumn
Type B: Ski enthusiasts & local food lovers → Corobay
Caroline is a skier. I live in Vancouver, but in winter, I live in a family cottage in Whistler. She is also a local food lover. The reason she was forced to become a local food lover was because of global warming. Feeling that Canada's winter has been changing for some time, she began to do small things she could do to prevent global warming, and one of them is local food. Local food is not only good for health by consuming fresh local produce, but it also has a positive impact on the environment as it reduces food miles (the distance from which produce is brought to the consumer's table) to reduce CO2 emissions.
Corobay exterior with containers
The moment I saw 'Coro Bay', I thought it was the perfect place for her. The name of the store is completely local. 'Korobay', which is also a foreign language, is a dialect of Pyeongchang-gun Bongpyeong. The husband and wife are also born and raised in Bongpyeong. Corobay is a local food café, where all ingredients are local produce first. Potatoes, sweet potatoes, and various vegetables are grown directly in the garden.
There are many windows inside Coro Bay, so you can enjoy the scenery.
Order a homemade burger set, one of our top menus. Burger patty is made directly from Pyeongchang Hanwoo and Handon. The French fries in the set menu are impressive. It's not French Fries that you had at a traditional hamburger shop. The shape of the dongle is different. The owner cuts and fry the potatoes grown in the garden at the same time as the order. It is lightly seasoned with Gourmet Salt and you can taste the authentic taste of potatoes in Gangwon-do.
Korobay's signature burger
There are various local food menus such as pasta made with buckwheat noodles, potato cream pasta made with potatoes in Gangwon-do, and ginger milk tea dipped in domestic hat ginger. It also sells natural fermented bread to accompany with tea. Bread is taken from a nearby bakery. Bread may be accompanied by jam, or apples or sweet potatoes harvested from the yard. Food ingredients grown close to 'Food Mile 0' are the basics, so it's a good choice for your health and the environment.
Introducing a variety of local food menus
<Things to Do next to Cafe> Phoenix Pyeongchang
Another reason for Caroline's applause for Coro Bay is the ski resort Phoenix Pyeongchang next door. Phoenix Snow Park is also the official venue of the PyeongChang Winter Olympics, where snowboarding and freestyle skiing are held.
Phoenix Pyeongchang, the official venue of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics
So it would be an attractive place for her who loves winter sports. I'm happy to see the Winter Olympics and ski.
Autumn scenery
Type C: Local Specialties Who Love Market Trips → Bread Buckwheat
Janice loves cooking and traveling. Whenever she travels around the world, she finds her local market first. Janice says the market is the perfect place to understand the local culture. Her hobby is finding and tasting local specialties at the market and cooking. 'Brew buckwheat' is a small bakery I would definitely recommend to her.
Breaded buckwheat on one side of the market
Bread buckwheat is run by a sibling from Pyeongchang and, as the name implies, uses 100% domestic buckwheat. In Pyeongchang and Jeju Island, I am buckwheat. Choi Hyo-ju, the baker's president, got a buckwheat bread idea from a friend from Canada a few years ago. When a Canadian friend stayed in Korea and went home, he wanted to buy buckwheat, a specialty of Pyeongchang. If you take buckwheat alone, food utilization will decrease. Seeing a friend's favorite buckwheat cookies are also delicious, I decided to make bread with buckwheat, a local specialty.
The sister in charge of bread (Hyo Joo Choi) and her brother in charge of tea and coffee
The bakery is small but there are various kinds of bread on the stand. Five-day bread, treasure chest, and goblin are interesting names. Bread ingredients are nice. The red beans that go into the red bean bread and the anvers are directly fried with red beans from Pyeongchang To complement the cold nature of red beans, use locally grown ginger. Use high quality local ingredients, such as cheese and milk from nearby ranches and cherry tomatoes from nearby farms.
Bread of various buckwheat
When you enter the store, you can see the phrase 'you can taste the hot bread only if you make a baker's owner'. Choi Hyo-ju, who has a good feeling, often offers sliced hot bread to people who visit the shop. Sit back for a moment and enjoy the warmth of a rural bakery with the bread made by your sister Choi Hyo-ju in a coffee from your brother Choi Seung-soo. The smell of people with the bread fills the space. If you visit Bread Buckwheat this winter, the space will be different. The bakery and tea drinking area are separated. The bakery is moved to the store next door, and now the bakery is transformed into a tea specialty shop run by Mr. Choi. 'Hyo-joo's bakery and' Soo-soo's tea shop will be side by side.
The owner, Hyo-joo Choi, makes the guests taste hot bread.
<Play next to bakery> Pyeongchang Olympic Market

Bread Buckwheat is located in the Pyeongchang Olympic Market (formerly Pyeongchang Traditional Market). You can enjoy the taste of Korean traditional market and taste buckwheat buckwheat, a specialty of Pyeongchang. Putting pure buckwheat flour dough and cabbage leaves on a pot lid pan and slicing it thinly provides interesting things for foreigners. With various buckwheat beaks and local specialties made with buckwheat, visitors to Pyeongchang are well worth a visit.

I'm already waiting. This winter. This is because they come to Canada to be surprised at the taste of Pyeongchang. Come on, guys. Is this your first time in Pyeongchang? Isn't the scenery and taste of Pyeongchang amazing?

Pyeongchang Olympic Market, where you can taste delicious buckwheat
